content.rendered:
A delicate foodie brand is sandwiched between a healthy dose of boldness and, not one but two, animal logos with work from Dallas, Manchester, and Nasvhille.

Buckley by Foundry Co.

The identity of National dog treat brand Buckley is as pet-able as a labrador puppy with a husky wordmark (the logo not the labrador puppy) and a very clever American flag-inspired icon that replaces the stars with a bone. Designed by Dallas, TX-based Foundry Co., the identity has a lively color palette, a delightful mascot of its own that gets turned into a great pattern, and just an overall good vibe. See full project.

The Great British Butcher by Design by Day

I don’t encourage flexibility for flexibility’s sake but I wish the logo for The Great British Butcher by Manchester, UK-based Design by Day had a different icons within the logo, keeping the hatchet at the center. Nonetheless, this is a superbly handsome application of the logo on some tasty-looking tins and the logo embroiders like chili on a rub (whatever that means). See full project.

Treadwell by Perky Bros

Kansas City, KS-based Treadwell installs floors so bad-ass that not even the tatanka on its logo could crack them. Or at least that’s the impression I get from this identity by Nashvile, TN-based Perky Bros with its killer color palette of dark blue, brown, and red and the meanest work order I have seen in a long time. I just love it when a small, non-flashy client like “floors” gets such an excellent identity. See full project.
